result.execSummary:
The defendant Wyatt Samuel Skenandore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
Joint and several.
Restitution paid in full directly to the victim from bond on deposit.

Maintain full time employment during probation.
Complete high school diploma, GED or HSED during first year of probation or while still in jail.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

No alcohol, controlled substances, illegal drugs or prescription medication unless prescribed by a Dr. and then only according to Dr.'s orders and as approved by agent.
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with co-defendant or known drug or alcohol abusers.

Counseling assessments and follow through as determined by agent.
Cognitive Intervention Course or any other course or assessment beneficial to defendant as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes:
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
No good time.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wyatt Samuel Skenandore in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Defendant Wyatt Samuel Skenandore in custody.  Kent R. Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:05 am
ADA spks on PSI
Atty Wallace agrees
ADA spks on sentencing
Victim addresses Court - K.M.
Atty Wallace spks on sentencing
Defendant addresses Court
Court imposes:  Imposed & Stayed 6 years; 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision.  Defendant is eligible for CIP & SAP.  3 years probation.
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge from bond.
6 months jail, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 133 days, no good time, huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
Restitution, joint and several, $200.52 (includes 10% surcharge) from bond.
Fine $200 + costs + service fees all from bond on deposit.
Complete High School diploma, GED or HSED during first year of probation or while still in jail.
Maintain full time employment during probation.
Counseling assessments and follow through as determined by agent.
Cognitive Intervention course or any other course or assessment beneficial to defendant as determined by agent.
No alcohol, drugss, illegal drugs or prescription medication unless prescribed by a Dr. and then only according to Dr.'s orders and as approved by agent.
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with co-defendant or known drug or alcohol abusers.
